intro: Chartolepis schizolepis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and clusters of fleshy, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and are often used in ornamental horticulture. Chartolepis schizolepis thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth.
